<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 2"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Scout Dedication](/Feats.aspx?ID=2047) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Archetype" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=12" />
<trait label="Dedication" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=41" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Advanced Player's Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=39) pg. 188 <sup>2.0</sup></row>

**Archetype** [Scout](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=73)

**Prerequisites**
Trained in [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=15); Trained in [Survival](/Skills.aspx?ID=16)

</column>

---

You are a highly skilled scout, capable of providing your allies a timely warning of any danger. You gain the [Scout's Warning](/Feats.aspx?ID=505) ranger feat. When you're using the [Scout](/Actions.aspx?ID=518) exploration activity, you grant your allies a +2 circumstance bonus to their initiative rolls instead of a +1 circumstance bonus.

**Special** You can't select another dedication feat until you have gained two other feats from the scout archetype.

<title level="2">Scout Dedication leads to...</title>
[Eclipsed Vitality](/Feats.aspx?ID=3613), [Fleeting Shadow](/Feats.aspx?ID=2050), [Rebel's Map](/Feats.aspx?ID=4135), [Scout's Charge](/Feats.aspx?ID=2048), [Scout's Pounce](/Feats.aspx?ID=2052), [Scout's Speed](/Feats.aspx?ID=2051), [Terrain Scout](/Feats.aspx?ID=2049)
name: Scout Dedication
prerequisite: Trained in Stealth; Trained in Survival
